CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier, January 14, 1967, pg. 1B, reads: The Synchronettes - This popular group of charming young matrons, combined fun with civic duty when they entertained at their annual holiday party.  Held at the Hotel Penn-Sheraton, the girls made a partial payment on a Life Membership in the NAACP at the party which featured music by Bobby Jones.  First row, left to right: Maxine Jackson, Rachel Poole, president and Sarah Gaines, social chairman.  Second row, from left: Josephine Bagley, Blanche Bridges, Gladyne Avent, vice president; Margaret Gunn and Bernice Parr, treasurer.  Third row: Elizabeth Hill, Juanita Brown and Virginia Sloan.  Last row: Redia Ellis and Eloise White."
TitMainTitle: Synchronettes Club members, first row from left: Maxine Jackson, Rachel Poole, Sarah Gaines; second row: Josephine Bagley, Blanche Bridges, Gladyne Avent, Margaret Gunn, Bernice Parr; third row: Elizabeth Hill, Juanita Brown, Virginia Sloan; fourth row: Redia Ellis and Eloise White, posed for holiday party at Penn-Sheraton Hotel
